data.name: RESBOOK
data.title: RESBOOK
content:
RESBOOK is my {{finals project}} at {{Business Academy Aarhus}} developed by me and my team. The project is a {{booking system}} for restaurants, where the user can book a table at a restaurant and the restaurant can manage their bookings.

The authentication, is the most noteworthy part of the project, taking advantage of next.js middleware and built from scratch using a combination of {{JWT}} and {{session tokens}}. (See the code on GitHub for more details)

The project consists of two frontends, one for the user, built in {{Next.js}} and one for the restaurant, built in {{React}}. The backend is built in {{Remix}} and uses a {{MySQL}} database to store the data.
The development was managed with {{GitHub Projects}}, taking advantage of {{feature branches}} and {{pull requests}} to ensure a smooth development process.
The frontends are deployed on {{Vercel}} and the backend is deployed on a {{PHP server}}.

data.name: Discord Bot
data.title: Discord Bot

images.alt: Screenshot of the bot running on the Raspberry Pi

content:
This Discord Bot is a {{personal project}} that I developed to learn more about, and getting more comfortable, with {{Node.js}} and backend in general.

The bot is hosted on my {{Raspberry Pi}} and is running 24/7, checking if a friend has played a new League of Legends game, using a {{Cron job}}, and {{posting}} the result, including {{stats}}, in a Discord channel using {{discord.js}}.
The bot is built with {{Node.js}} and uses the {{Riot API}} to get the game data. As mentioned, the bot is using {{Cron}} to check for new games every 5 minutes.
